thread.title: Fiction Chronicle: The Feminist Circle of Life

author: Sam Sacks
title: Fiction Chronicle: The Feminist Circle of Life
text:
In a paradigm- shifting essay for the New York Times in 2012, Meg Wolitzer considered the prejudices that had come to define the invidious category of “women’s fiction.” The label, she observed, reflexively denoted something miniature and domestic—a book for reading-group discussion, not for serious literary consideration. You could identify such books by their pastel-colored cover art and modest length, which enforced the idea that sprawling tomes were for men to produce, while women quietly whittled their two inches of ivory.
The...
